description: From Middle English veel, from Anglo-Norman veel, from Latin vitellus, diminutive of vitulus (“calf”). Doublet of vitellus.

entries.meaning: The flesh of a calf (i.e. a young bovine) used for food.

verbs.description: veal (third-person singular simple present veals, present participle vealing, simple past and past participle vealed)

entries.meaning: To raise a calf for meat production.
examples: The division outside the vealing place is for a cow that has, or is near having calf.
